Facebook: s birthday-donation program allows users to raise money for charities by donating their birthdays.
Facebook users can choose from 750: 000 non-profits and set a fundraising goal for their birthday fundraiser.
Initially: Facebook retained 5% of the donations for processing fees and fraud protection, but they eliminated those fees in 2017, ensuring that 100% of the donations go to the designated charities.
The claim that Facebook can use the: 300 million raised through birthday fundraisers as a tax-deductible write-off is unsubstantiated, as Facebook states that it is the users who may be eligible to write off the donations.
